channel.title: Best branch of computers to get into? (work wise)
channel.description:
There are many different branches of work revolving around computers. Networking, Programming, Designing, Hardware, Software, etc. I'm wanting to do a professional job in a few years working with computers. Currently I got an internship working with a computer business as an IT person in an office setting. This involves primarily software and hardware work, rarely hardware though. I know a lot about all branches, especially programming, and networking. I'm not wanting to be an IT forever, and I know there are many other companies that want me to work for them. I wanted a few different view points on what the best area of work would be best getting in to. I can do most, and have tons of knowledge on all of them.
Also, what jobs would you recommend (eg. Software Architect/Game Developer)
Here's what I'm professional level with.
- Various different types of computer languages. (HTML, CSS, PHP, Ajax, SQL, C, C#, Java, Javascript) - Security and Networking (Working with smooth and efficient network systems, including servers, switches, etc.) - Software (I can name about six different programs that can be used to do something on a computer. Eg. I can name several different text editors, understand how they work, and troubleshoot them if a problem occurs.) - Hardware (I can put together a computer in a matter of minutes, and I know about how all of the components of a computer work, and how they work together.)
I'm only 15, but, it's always good to plan for the future. Thanks for any suggestions you guys may have!

item.title: Best branch of computers to get into? (work wise)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

In my personal opinion, Designers have the best job out of everyone. I won’t write a wall of text in response to this, because I’m very tired, but feel free to send me a Private Message and I’ll get back to you when I return. You must be as good as you say if you’re interning in an I.T. Department at the age of 15 (lol).

Read full topic
item.source: Best branch of computers to get into? (work wise)

item.title: Best branch of computers to get into? (work wise)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

There are many different branches of work revolving around computers. Networking, Programming, Designing, Hardware, Software, etc. I’m wanting to do a professional job in a few years working with computers. Currently I got an internship working with a computer business as an IT person in an office setting. This involves primarily software and hardware work, rarely hardware though. I know a lot about all branches, especially programming, and networking. I’m not wanting to be an IT forever, and I know there are many other companies that want me to work for them. I wanted a few different view points on what the best area of work would be best getting in to. I can do most, and have tons of knowledge on all of them.

Also, what jobs would you recommend (eg. Software Architect/Game Developer)

Here’s what I’m professional level with.

  • Various different types of computer languages. (HTML, CSS, PHP, Ajax, SQL, C, C#, Java, Javascript)
  • Security and Networking (Working with smooth and efficient network systems, including servers, switches, etc.)
  • Software (I can name about six different programs that can be used to do something on a computer. Eg. I can name several different text editors, understand how they work, and troubleshoot them if a problem occurs.)
  • Hardware (I can put together a computer in a matter of minutes, and I know about how all of the components of a computer work, and how they work together.)

I’m only 15, but, it’s always good to plan for the future. Thanks for any suggestions you guys may have!
